Manage Workspaces¶

A workspace is a top-level resource for Azure Machine Learning and provides a centralized place to:

  • Work with all the artifacts you create during your ML lifecycle such as jobs, models, and endpoints.

  • Store a history of all your assets such as training logs, metrics, and snapshots.

  • Collaborate with other team members.

Create a workspace¶

To create a workspace with basic configurations:

az ml workspace create --name <NAME OF WORKSPACE>

Alternatively, you can also create the workspace by defining the parameters in a YAML file:

name: basic-ws-1

Then run the following command to create the workspace:

az ml workspace create --file <YAML FILE PATH>

Workspace specification¶

When using a YAML file to define the workspace parameters, it must follow the following schema.

Parameters

Description

name (required)

[string] The name of the workspace.

location

[string] The location to create the workspace in.

display_name

[string] An alternative display name.

tags

[object] Tags or annotations in the format of key: value

storage_account

[string] The resource ID of an existing storage account. If not specified, a new one will be created.

container_registry

[string] The resource ID of an existing container registry. If not specified, a new one will be created.

key_vault

[string] The resource ID of an existing key vault. If not specified, a new one will be created.

app_insights

[string] The resource ID of an existing application insights. If not specified, a new one will be created.

hbi_workspace

[boolean] Whether the customer data is of high business impact (HBI). If not specified, this will be set to false.

private_endpoints

[object] Private endpoint details. If not specified, users will be allowed to connect to the workspace from any IP addresses.

approval_type

[enum] The approval type to use on private endpoint connections to the workspace. AutoApproval or ManualApproval.

connections

[object] One or more connection objects where the key is the name and value is an object with the following params:

  • subscription_id: The ID of the subscription to create the private endpoint in.

  • resource-group: The resource group to create the private endpoint in.

  • location: The location to create the private endpoint in. If not specified, the workspace location will be used.

  • vnet_name: Name of the existing virtual network to deploy the private endpoint to.

  • subnet_name: Name of the existing subnet to deploy the private endpoint to.

customer_managed_keys

[object] Key vault details for encrypting data with customer-managed keys. If not specified, Microsoft-managed keys will be used.

key_vault

[string] The resource ID of the key vault containing the customer managed key.

key_uri

[string] The URI of the customer managed key to use for encrypting data.

Here are a few examples defining different kinds of workspaces.

Basic fields and annotations¶

name: basic-ws-2
location: EastUS
display_name: john-workspace
description: A workspace for testing enterprise readiness features
tags:
  purpose: testing
  team: ws-management

Existing associated resources¶

name: byo-resources-ws
location: EastUS
storage_account: /subscriptions/123456a-bc78-9d0e-12fg-h345i67jkl8m/resourceGroups/john/providers/Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/john123456789
container_registry: /subscriptions/123456a-bc78-9d0e-12fg-h345i67jkl8m/resourceGroups/john/providers/Microsoft.ContainerRegistry/registries/john123456789
key_vault: /subscriptions/123456a-bc78-9d0e-12fg-h345i67jkl8m/resourceGroups/john/providers/Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/john123456789
app_insights: /subscriptions/123456a-bc78-9d0e-12fg-h345i67jkl8m/resourceGroups/john/providers/Microsoft.insights/components/john123456789

Private endpoint connections¶

With a single private endpoint:

name: single-private-endpoint-ws
location: EastUS
private_endpoints: 
  approval_type: AutoApproval
  connections:
    my-endpoint:
      subscription_id: 123456a-bc78-9d0e-12fg-h345i67jkl8m
      resource_group: john
      location: EastUS
      vnet_name: my-vnet
      subnet_name: default

With multiple private endpoints:

name: multiple-private-endpint-ws.yml
location: EastUS
private_endpoints: 
  approval_type: ManualApproval
  connections:
    my-endpoint1:
      subscription_id: 123456a-bc78-9d0e-12fg-h345i67jkl8m
      resource_group: john
      location: EastUS
      vnet_name: my-vnet1
      subnet_name: default
    my-endpoint2:
      subscription_id: 123456a-bc78-9d0e-12fg-h345i67jkl8m
      resource_group: john
      location: EastUS
      vnet_name: my-vnet2
      subnet_name: default

Customer-managed keys¶

name: cmk-ws
location: EastUS
customer_managed_keys: 
  key_vault: /subscriptions/123456a-bc78-9d0e-12fg-h345i67jkl8m/resourceGroups/john/providers/Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/john123456789
  key_uri: https://mykeyvault.vault.azure.net/keys/test-key/1234567890123456

High business impact (HBI) flag¶

name: hbi-ws
location: EastUS
hbi_workspace: true

Update workspace¶

To update a workspace, specify the name of the workspace and a YAML file specifying the new workspace parameters:

az ml workspace update --name <NAME OF WORKSPACE> --file <YAML FILE PATH>

Show workspace¶

To show the details of an existing workspace:

az ml workspace show --name <NAME OF WORKSPACE>

Delete workspace¶

To delete an existing workspace:

az ml workspace delete --name <NAME OF WORKSPACE>

List keys in the workspace¶

To list the keys (storage account keys, etc) used in the workspace:

az ml workspace list-keys --name <NAME OF WORKSPACE>

Sync keys in the workspace¶

When workspace keys are rotated, you can reset the workspace cache to immediately sync with the new keys. To do this:

az ml workspace sync-keys --name <NAME OF WORKSPACE>
